passage_text: [ 2 syll. hen-drik, he-ndr-ik ] The baby boy name Hendrik is pronounced in Dutch and German as HH EH N-DRihK †. Hendrik is of Germanic origin. It is used mainly in Dutch, English, Estonian, German, and Scandinavian. Hendrik is a variation of Henry (English). The contracted forms Henk (Dutch) and Rik (Dutch) are variants of the name. See also the related form, Endrik (German). Hendrik is uncommon as a baby boy name. It is not listed within the top 1000.

Hendrik is a form of the name Henry. Henry derives from two Germanic elements, haim meaning home and ric meaning power ruler. It was introduced to Britain by the Normans and has been borne by eight kings of England. In its various forms, it has also been a popular royal name in many European countries. Henry derives from two Germanic elements, haim meaning home and ric meaning power, ruler. Hendrik is generally used as a boy's name. It consists of 7 letters and 2 syllables and is pronounced Hen-drik. In the U.S. in 2014, it ranked 2089 in baby name popularity for boys with 66 occurrences. Less than 5 girls were given the name.

Hendrik is a rare first name for men but a somewhat popular surname for both adults and children (#136783 out of 150436, Top 91%). (2000 U.S. Census). Displayed below is a comparison of the usage of the boy name Hendrik and related names. Enrico, Enrique (#414 last year) , Hal, Hank (#602) , Harry (#714) , Henri, Henrik (#863) and Henry (#33) are the prominent variation forms of Hendrik (outside Top 1000) .

Hendrik /hen-drik/ [2 sylls.] as a name for boys is of Old German derivation, and Hendrik means home leader. Hendrik is an alternate form of Hendrick (English, Danish, Old German): transcription of Henry. Compare surname Hendrix. Kreatif forms: Hedrik, Herdrik, Hundrik. Displayed below is a comparison of the usage of the boy name Hendrik and related names. Enrico, Enrique (#414 last year) , Hal, Hank (#602) , Harry (#714) , Henri, Henrik (#863) and Henry (#33) are the prominent variation forms of Hendrik (outside Top 1000) .

Danish Meaning: The name Henrik is a Danish baby name. In Danish the meaning of the name Henrik is: Teutonic Meaning: The name Henrik is a Teutonic baby name. In Teutonic the meaning of the name Henrik is: Rules an estate. Swedish Meaning: The name Henrik is a Swedish baby name. In Swedish the meaning of the name Henrik is: rules the home'. Scandinavian Meaning: The name Henrik is a Scandinavian baby name. In Scandinavian the meaning of the name Henrik is: Rules his household.

Meanings and history of the name Henrik : | Edit. Henrik is Germanic in origin and means ruler of the home. The use of this name is most popular in Scandinavia, Estonia, Hungary and Slovenia. Equivalents in other languages are Henry (English), Heikki (Finnish), Hendrik (Dutch), Heinrich (German), Henri (French), Henrique (Portuguese) and Henryk (Polish). The name, introduced by the Normans and borne by eight English kings, took the English vernacular form of Harry until the 17th century, when Henry became popular and Harry was used as the pet form. From A World of Baby Names by Teresa Norman

People with this name have a deep inner desire for travel and adventure, and want to set their own pace in life without being governed by tradition.
